alternative_parents.description: Homoisoflavonoids with a structure based on the chromone system. Chromone is a bicyclic compound consisting of a 1-benzopyran, which bears a ketone group at the 4-position.
alternative_parents.name: Homoisoflavones

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds with a structure based on a C6-C3-C6 skeleton, where the two benzene rings are not linked together.
alternative_parents.name: Linear 1,3-diarylpropanoids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a biphenyl moiety substituted at one or more positions by a bromine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Brominated biphenyls

alternative_parents.description: Polycyclic aromatic compounds containing a 1-benzopyran moiety with a ketone group at the C2 carbon atom (1-benzopyran-2-one).
alternative_parents.name: Coumarins and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a pyran ring which bears a ketone.
alternative_parents.name: Pyranones and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a bromine atom attached to a benzene ring.
alternative_parents.name: Bromobenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the acyl bromide functional group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl bromides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a hydroxyl group, which is indirectly attached to a carbonyl via an intervening vinyl (>C=C<) moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Vinylogous acids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a bromine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organobromides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an alcohol group attached to an aromatic carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Aromatic alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Phenylpropanoids with a structure containing two  aromatic rings joined by a seven carbons (a 1,7-diphenylheptane skeleton) and may have various substituents.
class.name: Diarylheptanoids

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as linear diarylheptanoids. These are diarylheptanoids with an open heptane chain. The two aromatic rings are linked only by the heptane chain.

direct_parent.description: Diarylheptanoids with an open heptane chain. The two aromatic rings are linked only by the heptane chain.
direct_parent.name: Linear diarylheptanoids

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

predicted_lipidmaps_terms: Diphenyl ethers, biphenyls, dibenzyls and stilbenes (PK1309)

subclass.description: Diarylheptanoids with an open heptane chain. The two aromatic rings are linked only by the heptane chain.
subclass.name: Linear diarylheptanoids

superclass.description: Organic compounds that are synthesized either from the amino acid phenylalanine (phenylpropanoids) or the decarboxylative condensation of malonyl-CoA (polyketides). Phenylpropanoids are aromatic compounds based on the phenylpropane skeleton. Polyketides usually consist of alternating carbonyl and methylene groups (beta-polyketones), biogenetically derived from repeated condensation of acetyl coenzyme A (via malonyl coenzyme A), and usually the compounds derived from them by further condensations.
superclass.name: Phenylpropanoids and polyketides
